001package io.jstach.ezkv.kvs;
002
003import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
004import java.net.URI;
005import java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException;
006import java.util.Optional;
007import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
008import java.util.function.Predicate;
009
010import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesMediaFinder;
011import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesLoaderFinder.LoaderContext;
012import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.Variables.Parameters;
013
014/**
015 * A service provider interface (SPI) for extending ezkv's capabilities to support
016 * additional media types and URI patterns. Implementations of this interface can be
017 * loaded using {@link java.util.ServiceLoader}.
018 *
019 * <p>
020 * This SPI allows customization and extension of ezkv's loading mechanisms and media type
021 * parsing.
022 *
023 * <p>
024 * Note: This interface is sealed, and any sub-interface implementations must be
025 * registered using {@code provides KeyValuesServiceProvider with ...} in the
026 * {@code module-info.java} or as entries in the
027 * {@code META-INF/services/io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider} file.
028 * Sub-interfaces such as {@link KeyValuesLoaderFinder} and {@link KeyValuesMediaFinder}
029 * should <strong>not</strong> be directly referenced in the service registration.
030 *
031 * <p>
032 * Example use cases include adding support for custom media types or integrating
033 * specialized URI loading logic.
034 */
035public sealed interface KeyValuesServiceProvider {
036
037        /**
038         * A service provider interface for finding {@link KeyValuesLoader} implementations
039         * that can handle specific {@link KeyValuesResource} instances.
040         */
041        public non-sealed interface KeyValuesLoaderFinder extends KeyValuesServiceProvider {
042
043                /**
044                 * A context provided to {@link KeyValuesLoaderFinder} implementations to supply
045                 * necessary dependencies and services for creating a {@link KeyValuesLoader}.
046                 */
047                public sealed interface LoaderContext {
048
049                        /**
050                         * Retrieves the {@link KeyValuesEnvironment} for accessing system-level
051                         * resources and properties.
052                         * @return the environment instance
053                         */
054                        KeyValuesEnvironment environment();
055
056                        /**
057                         * Retrieves the {@link KeyValuesMediaFinder} for finding media types.
058                         * @return the media finder instance
059                         */
060                        KeyValuesMediaFinder mediaFinder();
061
062                        /**
063                         * Retrieves the {@link Variables} used for interpolation.
064                         * @return the variables instance
065                         */
066                        Variables variables();
067
068                        /**
069                         * Finds and returns a required parser for the specified
070                         * {@link KeyValuesResource}. Throws an exception if no parser is found.
071                         * @param resource the resource for which to find a parser
072                         * @return the parser for the resource
073                         * @throws KeyValuesMediaException if no parser is found for the resource's
074                         * media type
075                         */
076                        default KeyValuesMedia.Parser requireParser(KeyValuesResource resource) throws KeyValuesMediaException {
077                                var media = mediaFinder() //
078                                        .findByResource(resource) //
079                                        .orElseThrow(() -> new KeyValuesMediaException("Media Type not found. resource: " + resource));
080                                return new SafeParser(media.parser(resource.parameters()), media.getMediaType());
081                        }
082
083                        /**
084                         * Formats a {@link KeyValuesResource} into its key-value representation and
085                         * applies it to a given consumer. This method allows serializing the resource
086                         * into key-value pairs.
087                         * @param resource the resource to format
088                         * @param consumer the consumer to apply the formatted key-value pairs
089                         */
090                        void formatResource(KeyValuesResource resource, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer);
091
092                        /**
093                         * Formats a resource parameter key how it is represented as key in the parsed
094                         * resource.
095                         * @param resource resource to base the full parameter name on.
096                         * @param parameterName the short parameter from
097                         * {@link KeyValuesResource#parameters()}.
098                         * @return FQ parameter name.
099                         */
100                        String formatParameterKey(KeyValuesResource resource, String parameterName);
101
102                }
103
104                /**
105                 * Finds a {@link KeyValuesLoader} capable of loading the specified
106                 * {@link KeyValuesResource} using the provided {@link LoaderContext}. <strong>If
107                 * the resource cannot be found the returned {@link KeyValuesLoader} should throw
108                 * a {@link FileNotFoundException} or {@link NoSuchFileException} to indicate not
109                 * found and not Optional.empty which conversely means no matching loader could be
110                 * found based on the resource. </strong>
111                 * @param context the context containing dependencies and services
112                 * @param resource the resource for which a loader is sought
113                 * @return an {@link Optional} containing the loader if found, or empty if not
114                 * @see KeyValuesLoader#load()
115                 */
116                public Optional<? extends KeyValuesLoader> findLoader(LoaderContext context, KeyValuesResource resource);
117
118        }
119
120        /**
121         * A service provider interface (SPI) for filtering key values after a resource is
122         * loaded.
123         *
124         * <p>
125         * Filters are applied to modify, rename, or remove key-value pairs without altering
126         * the original resource. This can be useful for transforming keys to a desired format
127         * or eliminating unnecessary entries before the key values are processed further.
128         *
129         * <h2>Usage</h2>
130         * <p>
131         * A {@code KeyValuesFilter} is invoked after a {@link KeyValuesResource} is loaded
132         * but before the resulting {@link KeyValues} are passed to the next stage of
133         * processing. The filter uses a filter name and optional parameters to determine how
134         * the key values should be modified.
135         * </p>
136         *
137         * Filters are enabled by using the {@link KeyValuesResource#KEY_FILTER} key where the
138         * default syntax is <code>_filter_[resourceName]_[filterId]=expression</code>.
139         *
140         * <h2>Builtin Filters</h2>
141         *
142         * <h3><code>grep</code></h3>
143         *
144         * Grep will filter keys by a regular expression. If the expression matches any part
145         * of the key the key value is included.
146         *
147         * {@snippet lang = properties :
148         *
149         * _load_resource=...
150         * _filter_resource_grep=someregex
151         *
152         * }
153         *
154         * <h3><code>sed</code></h3>
155         *
156         * Sed can change the keys name with subsitution or drop keys altogether. It follows a
157         * subset of the UNIX sed command where "<code>s</code>" and "<code>d</code>" are
158         * supported commands.
159         *
160         * {@snippet lang = properties :
161         *
162         * _load_resource=...
163         * _filter_resource_sed=/match/ s/replace/withme/g
164         *
165         * }
166         *
167         * <h2>Extensibility</h2>
168         * <p>
169         * Implementations of {@code KeyValuesFilter} can be registered using the
170         * {@code provides} directive in {@code module-info.java} or the
171         * {@code META-INF/services} mechanism with the fully qualified name of
172         * {@link KeyValuesServiceProvider}. <strong>Ideally the filter only applies filtering
173         * based on the passed in filter name.</strong> Otherwise it should just return the
174         * passed in key values.
175         * </p>
176         *
177         * <p>
178         * For example, to provide a custom implementation:
179         * </p>
180         * <pre>{@code
181         * module my.module {
182         *     provides io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider with my.module.MyKeyValuesFilter;
183         * }
184         * }</pre>
185         *
186         * <h2>Method Details</h2>
187         *
188         * <p>
189         * The {@link #filter(FilterContext, KeyValues, Filter)} method performs the filtering
190         * operation.
191         * </p>
192         */
193        public non-sealed interface KeyValuesFilter extends KeyValuesServiceProvider {
194
195                /**
196                 * Provides contextual information to a filter, including the environment and any
197                 * parameters specified for the filtering operation.
198                 *
199                 * @param environment the environment used to access system-level properties and
200                 * resources
201                 * @param parameters resource parameters that come from
202                 * {@link KeyValuesResource#KEY_PARAM} keys.
203                 * @param keyValueIgnore keys that should be ignored and not filtered if the
204                 * predicate returns <code>true</code>.
205                 * @see KeyValuesResource#FLAG_NO_FILTER_RESOURCE_KEYS
206                 */
207                public record FilterContext(KeyValuesEnvironment environment, Parameters parameters,
208                                Predicate<KeyValue> keyValueIgnore) {
209                }
210
211                /**
212                 * A filter description with filter identifier and expression which is the DSL
213                 * code that the filter will parse use to do filtering.
214                 *
215                 * @param filter filter identifier.
216                 * @param expression string code used by the filter to determine filtering.
217                 * @param name used to differentiate multiple calls to the same filter type when
218                 * looking up parameters. Defaults to empty string.
219                 */
220                public record Filter(String filter, String expression, String name) {
221
222                }
223
224                /**
225                 * Applies a filter to the given key-value pairs. The filter should ideally only
226                 * be applied if the passed filter parameter matches (filter name) otherwise the
227                 * filter should return {@link Optional#empty()} which indicates the filter did
228                 * not match or was not applicable. Note that if the filter is applicable but
229                 * wants to return an empty key values it should return an Optional of empty key
230                 * values and not {@link Optional#empty()}.
231                 * @param context the filter context providing the environment and parameters
232                 * @param keyValues the key-value pairs to be filtered
233                 * @param filter filter description
234                 * @return an optional {@link KeyValues} instance with the filtered key-value
235                 * pairs
236                 * @throws IllegalArgumentException or subclass if the filter expression is
237                 * malformed.
238                 * @throws KeyValuesException if some other key value parsing like error happens.
239                 */
240                Optional<KeyValues> filter(FilterContext context, KeyValues keyValues, Filter filter)
241                                throws IllegalArgumentException, KeyValuesException;
242
243        }
244
245        /**
246         * A service provider interface for finding {@link KeyValuesMedia} implementations
247         * based on various attributes such as file extensions, media types, and URIs.
248         */
249        public non-sealed interface KeyValuesMediaFinder extends KeyValuesServiceProvider {
250
251                /**
252                 * Finds a {@link KeyValuesMedia} based on the attributes of a given
253                 * {@link KeyValuesResource}.
254                 * @param resource the resource for which to find the media type
255                 * @return an {@link Optional} containing the media if found, or empty if not
256                 */
257                default Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByResource(KeyValuesResource resource) {
258                        String mediaType = resource.mediaType();
259                        if (mediaType == null) {
260                                return findByUri(resource.uri());
261                        }
262                        return findByMediaType(mediaType);
263                }
264
265                /**
266                 * Finds a {@link KeyValuesMedia} based on a file extension.
267                 * @param ext the file extension (e.g., "properties")
268                 * @return an {@link Optional} containing the media if found, or empty if not
269                 */
270                public Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByExt(String ext);
271
272                /**
273                 * Finds a {@link KeyValuesMedia} based on a media type string.
274                 * @param mediaType the media type (e.g., "application/json")
275                 * @return an {@link Optional} containing the media if found, or empty if not
276                 */
277                public Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByMediaType(String mediaType);
278
279                /**
280                 * Finds a {@link KeyValuesMedia} based on a {@link URI}.
281                 * @param uri the URI to analyze
282                 * @return an {@link Optional} containing the media if found, or empty if not
283                 */
284                public Optional<KeyValuesMedia> findByUri(URI uri);
285
286        }
287
288}
289
290record DefaultLoaderContext(KeyValuesEnvironment environment, KeyValuesMediaFinder mediaFinder, Variables variables,
291                KeyValuesResourceParser resourceParser) implements LoaderContext {
292        static LoaderContext of(KeyValuesSystem system, Variables variables, KeyValuesResourceParser resourceParser) {
293                return new DefaultLoaderContext(system.environment(), system.mediaFinder(), variables, resourceParser);
294        }
295
296        @Override
297        public void formatResource(KeyValuesResource resource, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) {
298                resourceParser.formatResource(resource, consumer);
299        }
300
301        @Override
302        public String formatParameterKey(KeyValuesResource resource, String parameterName) {
303                return resourceParser.formatParameterKey(resource, parameterName);
304        }
305
306}
